Package sample

Class StartMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • sample.StartMenu
  • public class StartMenu
extends java.lang.Object
    StartMenu is the class that will represent the first menu that is seen when the game is started up. Each method in the class will open another sub menu which are opened by the buttons in the GUI.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      javafx.scene.control.ChoiceBox gameType  
      javafx.scene.control.ChoiceBox numPlayers  
      javafx.scene.control.PasswordField secretToken  
      javafx.scene.control.TextField serverNameBox  
      javafx.scene.control.ChoiceBox waitTime  

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      StartMenu()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void createGame()
      createGame will create a game based on the options that are specified by the user in the menu.
      void endGame()
      endGame will be the linked to the exit game button in the start menu.
      void goToCreateMenu​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      goToCreateMenu will be linked with the create server button in the main menu.
      void goToJoinMenu()
      goToJoinMenu will open a stage and scene which will be the join submenu It is linked to the choose server button in the menu.
      void joinGame()
      Within the JoinMenu we will join a pre created server if there is a server name and token specified by the user.
      void returnToMenu​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      returnToMenu will be linked to the exit button on each submenu which will take us back to the mainMenu.
      void runTutorial()
      Run tutorial will be linked to the tutorial button.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • StartMenu

        public StartMenu()

    • Method Detail

      • endGame

        public void endGame()
        endGame will be the linked to the exit game button in the start menu.

      • runTutorial

        public void runTutorial()
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Run tutorial will be linked to the tutorial button. The funciton willopen a new stage and scene which will represent the tutorial.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throws an exception if the resource fxml file cannot be found.

      • returnToMenu

        public void returnToMenu​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        returnToMenu will be linked to the exit button on each submenu which will take us back to the mainMenu.
        Parameters:
        event - The event which will be used to signal the close the current stage.

      • goToCreateMenu

        public void goToCreateMenu​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        goToCreateMenu will be linked with the create server button in the main menu. The method will create a new scene and stage which will be the create sub menu.
        Parameters:
        event - the event which will trigger the function.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throws an exception if the fxml for create menu cannot be found.

      • goToJoinMenu

        public void goToJoinMenu()
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        goToJoinMenu will open a stage and scene which will be the join submenu It is linked to the choose server button in the menu.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throws an exception if the fxml for join menu cannot be found.

      • joinGame

        public void joinGame()
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Within the JoinMenu we will join a pre created server if there is a server name and token specified by the user.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - joinGame throws an expection if playField.fxml cannot be found.

      • createGame

        public void createGame()
                throws java.lang.Exception
        createGame will create a game based on the options that are specified by the user in the menu. Once a game is created a playField is created as we wait for the other players to join the game.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - createGame throws an expection if playField.fxml cannot be found.
